text: before Einstein our understanding of
time was basically due to Newton and it
aligned with our intuition time in the
mathematics of Newton is pretty much
time as we experience it when Einstein
came along that all changed with the
special theory of relativity he showed
that past present and future that kind
of way of dividing up our understanding
of time that isn't as fundamental as you
would think it is he showed in essence
that different observers in the world
moving with respect to one another
different speeds won't agree on what is
past present and future
what's past for me might be future for
someone else what's present for me might
be past for someone else so when you
take it all together past present and
future are not a kind of demarcation
that's universal in fact Einstein
summarized this to the widow of a close
friend of his by trying to console her
by saying that past present and future
that's only an illusion however
persistence
you
